qas.question: How many ways did Raimon Panikkar believed cultural change can be based on?
What is the term used to describe what Modernization could be similar or related to?
What type of society was seen that came from Raimon's 29 ways?
How many ways did Raimon Panikkar believe cultural consistency can be based on?
What is the term used to describe what Modernization could be opposite of?
What type of society was not seen from Raimon's 29 ways?
What kind of society is very religious?
Who pointed out there are 26 ways in which cultural change can be brought about?

context: <b7_0>Raimon Panikkar<b7_0/> pointed out <a0_0><b3_0>29 ways<b3_0/><a0_0/> in which cultural change can be brought about. Some of these are: growth, development, evolution, involution, renovation, reconception, reform, innovation, revivalism, revolution, mutation, progress, diffusion, osmosis, borrowing, eclecticism, syncretism, modernization, indigenization, and transformation. Hence Modernization could be similar or related to the <a1_0><b4_0>enlightenment<b4_0/><a1_0/> but a 'looser' term set to ideal and values that flourish. a belief in objectivity progress. Also seen as a belief in a <a2_0><b5_0><b6_0>secular<b6_0/> society<b5_0/><a2_0/> (free from religious influences) example objective and rational, science vs religion and finally been modern means not being religious.
